definition: to mix/to mingle/muddled/to drift along/to muddle along/to pass for/to get along with sb/thoughtless/reckless

sentences.english: The boys were in the compound loafing .
sentences.chinese: 僱工們都在圍場上閒混。

sentences.english: She loitered away the whole morning.
sentences.chinese: 她把整個上午的時間閒混過去了。

sentences.english: Billy dawdled behind her all morning.
sentences.chinese: 比利整個上午都跟在她後面閒混。

sentences.english: The job hunter dawdled all morning but achieved nothing.
sentences.chinese: 這個找工作的人閒混了一個上午，一無所獲。

sentences.english: There was no work in the factory this week so everyone idled about there.
sentences.chinese: 本週工廠沒事幹，大家都在那兒閒混。

sentences.english: He spent half the day arsing around.
Mother asked me to stop idling about.
That way, we won't have any regrets that we goofed around achieving nothing at all.
sentences.chinese: 那樣的話，我們就不會遺憾整日閒混無成就。

sentences.english: I whiled the whole day away reading novels.
sentences.chinese: 我看小說閒混了一整天。

sentences.english: A young man idle, an old man needy.
